    • Method Detail

      • createSettings

        private void createSettings()

      • getHelpButton

        private javax.swing.JButton getHelpButton()

      • captureScreenSection

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage captureScreenSection(java.awt.Rectangle section)
        Capture the pixels of the specified screen rectangle into an ImageBuffer. The trick is the ScreenMagnifier's frame has to be made invisible first so it does not show up in the image.
        Parameters:
        section - A rectangle specifying the range of pixels to capture.
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage containing the captured pixel range.

      • getFrameRectangle

        java.awt.Rectangle getFrameRectangle()
        Place the current frame size and location into a Rectangle object.
        Returns:
        A Rectangle containing the ScreenMagnifier's location, plus width and height in pixels.

      • getScreenRectangle

        java.awt.Rectangle getScreenRectangle()
        Place the current screen size and location into a Rectangle object.
        Returns:
        A Rectangle containing the current screen location (0,0), plus width and height in pixels.

      • componentMoved

        public void componentMoved(java.awt.event.ComponentEvent e)
        Respond to frame movement event by showing new image based on the screen section of interest for this new position. This event may occur once at the end of the move or it may occur at multiple points during the move. The latter causes a flashing image, but I have not been able to determine how to limit it to one event occurance.
        Specified by:
        componentMoved in interface java.awt.event.ComponentListener

      • componentResized

        public void componentResized(java.awt.event.ComponentEvent e)
        Respond to frame resize event by showing new image based on the screen section of interest for this new size. This event may occur once at the end of the resize or it may occur at multiple points during the resize. The latter causes a flashing image, but I have not been able to determine how to limit it to one event occurance.
        Specified by:
        componentResized in interface java.awt.event.ComponentListener
